title.rendered: What Are the Licenses Required for Starting a Business in Dubai?

content.rendered:
A business license is the key that boosts your momentum for the long haul. Dubai, the epicenter of business, can be daunting for new entrepreneurs who want quick and fast resolution of their queries for a quick start to their business. Obtaining a business license in Dubai is never easy unless you are guided by experts and professionals, who have helped thousands, if not millions of people.

Business setup in Dubai is the new face of entrepreneurship, given the kind of tax relief and government support it holds for the startup community. However, before you can start a business in Dubai, you will need to obtain a business license for generating revenue.

 

Firstly, let’s cover the basics.

What is a Business License?

A business license is a government-issued permit that allows a business to operate legally. It is a requirement for most businesses, regardless of their size or industry.

Business licenses are issued by local governments, such as cities or counties. The requirements for obtaining a business license vary from place to place, but they typically include providing information about the business, such as its name, address, and type of business.

Business licenses are important for several reasons. They help to ensure that businesses are compliant with local laws and regulations. They also help to protect consumers by ensuring that businesses are properly licensed and insured.

What Are the Types of Business Licenses in Dubai?

There are the following three main types of business licenses in Dubai:

  1. Commercial License: This is the most common type of Dubai business license. You will need this license to do commercial activities like selling products or providing services. The cost of a commercial license in Dubai varies depending on the type of business and the size of the business.
  2. Industrial License: This type of license is required for businesses that engage in manufacturing or production activities. The cost of an industrial license also varies depending on the type of business and the size of the business.
  3. Professional License: Businesses offering professional services, such as accounting, law, or engineering will need to obtain this type of license. The cost of a professional license in Dubai varies depending on the type of business and the qualifications of the professionals who are providing the services.

For reference, check out the following varieties of licenses according to different sectors.

  1. Trade license: A business that sells goods and services will need a trade license.
  2. Food and beverage license: A business that sells food or beverages requires a food and beverage license.
  3. Construction license: A business that engages in construction activities will need a construction license.
  4. Tourism license: A tourism license is required for a business that provides tourism-related services.
  5. Education license: An education license is required for a company that provides educational services.

In addition to these common licenses, many other licenses may be required depending on the specific type of business you are starting. For example, if you are starting a medical clinic, you will need a medical license. If you are starting a financial services business, you will need a financial services license.

Where Can I Get My Business License in Dubai?

You can obtain licenses from the Department of Economic Development (DED). The DED is the government agency responsible for regulating businesses in Dubai. The DED license in Dubai holds the utmost importance for any business.

The DED has a website where you can find information about the different types of licenses and how to apply for them. You can also contact the DED directly for assistance.

What Are the Prerequisites Before Obtaining a Business License in Dubai?

Discussed below are a few prerequisites before obtaining a business license in Dubai:

  • A sponsor: If you are a non-GCC national, you will need a sponsor to obtain a business license in Dubai. A sponsor can be a UAE national or a company that is already registered in Dubai. The sponsor will be responsible for providing financial support for the business and will have some control over the management of the business.
  • A trade name: You will be required to pick a trade name for your startup. The trade name must be unique and cannot be the same as any other trade name that is already registered in Dubai.
  • A business address: You will need to have a registered business address in Dubai. This address can be your home address or rented office space.
  • A Memorandum of Association (MOA) and Articles of Association (AOA): You will need to have an MOA and AOA for your business. These documents will outline the structure and management of your business.
  • A photocopy of your passport: You will need to provide a photocopy of your passport to the Department of Economic Development (DED) when you apply for a business license.
  • A copy of your visa: If you are a non-GCC national, you will need to provide a copy of your visa to the DED when you apply for a business license.
  • A lease agreement: If you are renting a business space, you will need to provide a copy of the lease agreement to the DED when you apply for a business license.
  • A trade license application form: You will need to complete a trade license application form and submit it to the DED.
  • The application fee: You will need to pay the application fee when you submit your application form for a trade license.

Once you have met all of the prerequisites, you can submit your application form to obtain a trade license to the DED. The DED will review your application and will approve or reject it within a few weeks. If your application is approved, you will be issued a trade license.

What Are the Benefits of Holding a Dubai Business License?

There are a number of benefits to obtaining a business license in Dubai. Here are some of the most important ones:

  • Legality: A business license allows you to operate your business legally. This means that you are complying with all of the relevant laws and regulations.
  • Credibility: A business license gives you credibility with customers and clients. It shows that you are a legitimate business that has been vetted by the government.
  • Access to resources: A business license may give you access to government resources, such as loans or grants.
  • Protection: A business license can help to protect you from liability. If something goes wrong with your business, the government may be able to help you to defend yourself against legal action.
  • Tax benefits: Businesses with a valid license are eligible for certain tax benefits, such as reduced corporate tax rates.
  • Access to markets: A business license can help you to access new markets, both domestically and internationally.
  • Enhanced confidence of customers: Customers feel more confident and motivated to do business with a company that has a valid business license.

How to Get a Business License Quickly and Easily?

In this fast-paced world, every entrepreneur is on the hunt to make things fast and quick. And you have entered the right place. A&A Associate, with its 15+ years of experience in helping people get their desired business on track, has excelled and presented itself as the master consultant for 1000s of founders and business owners.

Contact us today to get your license within the next 3-5 days.  Call at +971 56 408 6728
